intro: Veronica kiusiana f. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved speedwell, is a compact evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It features small, dark green, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along its stems. The plant produces clusters of blue or violet flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a vibrant touch to its foliage. It is well-suited for rock gardens and containers due to its compact size and ornamental appeal. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for both gardeners and botanists interested in its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
